meanings.definition: The state of being outside or beyond something.
meanings.sent1: The extrality of the garden fence made it easy for the cat to escape.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the extrality of the tree branches reaching over the wall.
meanings.sent3: The extrality of the cake from the fridge led to a mystery in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her extrality from the noisy crowd was like finding peace in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The extrality of the stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The quality of being external or separate from something else.
meanings.sent1: The extrality of the new building stood out among the old houses.
meanings.sent2: I admired the extrality of the painting on the gallery wall.
meanings.sent3: The extrality of the cat's meow startled the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: His extrality in the group made him feel like a lone wolf.
meanings.sent5: The extrality of the mountain peak against the blue sky was striking.
